question: B 02 (a)
sols_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} v_{AB} = B-A = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix} - \begin{bmatrix}0 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

and let

\[\begin{aligned} v_{AC} = C-A = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix} - \begin{bmatrix}0 & 1 & 2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Then, the area of a triangle is given by

\[\begin{aligned} \text{Area} &= 1/2\|v_{AB}\times v_{AC}\|\end{aligned}\]

Computing the cross product gives

\[\begin{aligned} v_{AB}\times v_{AC} = \begin{bmatrix} -2 & -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Taking the norm and dividing by 2 yields

\[\begin{aligned} \text{Area} &= 1/2\|v_{AB}\times v_{AC}\| = 1/2 \|\begin{bmatrix} -2 & -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\| = \frac{\sqrt{(-2)^2 + (-1)^2 + 1^2}}{2} = \frac{\sqrt{6}}{2}\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:
Let \(A = (0,1,2)\), \(B = (1,0,3)\) and \(C = (1,1,4)\). Let \(\Delta\) be the triangle whose vertices are A,B, and C.

Find the area of \(\Delta\).
